questions.question: Where is the Parable of the Sower found, which explains why Jesus spoke in parables and illustrates different responses to the Word of God?
Where is the Parable of the Mustard Seed, describing the kingdom of heaven as a small seed that grows into a large tree?
Where can we find the Parable of the Lost Sheep, which tells of a shepherd leaving ninety-nine sheep to find the one that is lost?
Where is the Parable of the Hidden Treasure, involving a man who finds a hidden treasure in a field and sells everything he has to buy that field?
Where is the Parable of the Prodigal Son, featuring a father who welcomes his wayward son back home?
Where is the Parable of the Unforgiving Servant, emphasizing the importance of forgiveness through a king settling accounts with his servants?
Where is the Parable of the Net, likening the kingdom of heaven to a net that catches all kinds of fish, which are then sorted by the fishermen?
Where is the Parable of the Rich Fool, describing a rich man who stores up earthly treasures but is not rich toward God?
Where is the Parable of the Wedding Banquet, comparing the kingdom of heaven to a wedding feast where many are invited but few are chosen?
Where is the Parable of the Wise and Foolish Builders, featuring a wise and foolish builder, and emphasizing the importance of building one's life on Jesus' teachings?
Where is the Parable of the Pearl of Great Price, involving a man finding a pearl of great value and selling all he has to buy it?
Where is the Parable of the Ten Virgins, in which Jesus talks about ten virgins waiting for the bridegroom, emphasizing the importance of being prepared?
Where is the Parable of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector, highlighting the importance of humility through the prayers of a tax collector and a Pharisee?
Where is the Parable of the Workers in the Vineyard, describing a landowner hiring laborers at different times of the day, yet paying them all the same wage?
Where is the Parable of the Weeds, in which Jesus teaches about a farmer sowing good seed in his field, only to have an enemy sow weeds among the wheat?
